p: We have followed the Chigunadze et al. model to induce frostbite [ 31] with minor modifications. Animals were anesthetized with ketamine and xylazine (10 : 1), and hair was removed with hair removal cream (Veet cream). It was applied for 3 minutes, and then, cream was removed with dried and wet cotton swabs, respectively. Simulated contact frostbite was produced with the help of metal weighing 3.5 × 3 cm which was precooled up to -73°C in a freezer. It was then made to contact the shaved area of the rat's skin for 3 minutes ( Figure 1). After induction of injury, animals were returned to their cages for completion of the thawing process at room temperature. Standard and test drug treatment was started after 24 h.
